r:Description.r:Content: Usage: ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: Title of the EQB XML document - note that the Study Title goes in /codeBook/stdyDscr/citation/titlStmt/titl
Required: Mandatory if 'titl' element is present
Usage: ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: Information on the copyright of the study documentation.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if '..prodStmt/copyright' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Usage: A name of the organization or institution
Required: Mandatory if '../distStmt/distrbtr' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: If applicable: abbreviation of the institution's name
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Usage: A URL or URN (a reference to a web resource that specifies its location) linking to the study to a CDC page.
EQB_UI_Label: Link to study in CESSDA Data Catalogue.
Usage: A title or name for the study. If additional titles are required in other languages, use the parTitl element
Required: Mandatory if '..stdyDscr/citation/titlStmt/titl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used

Usage: Title of the Study in additional languages other than the 'titl' element. It is preferable to include this element to hold an English version of the title if the 'titl' element is not in English.
Required: Mandatory if '..stdyDscr/citation/titlStmt/partitl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used

Usage: The content of this element serves two purposes. It is used both for the PID and for the study/archival number given by the SP. These two cases have different specifications. IDNo in the sense of study number is optional. PID is mandatory
Usage: Language is recommended when the @agency attribute contains an organisation name, for example, in the context of 'IDNo' being used to display the internal study number

Usage: Agency responsible for the identifier of the study. If you are using IDNo for a Persistent Identifer, value should be one of https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/vocabulary/CessdaPersistentIdentifierTypes i.e. ARK or DOI or Handle or URN
Usage: Person OR Institution. Principal Investigator not used in EQB but mandatory in CDC.

Usage: Language of the Organisation name, which may be the contents of the AuthEnty element or the @affiliation attribute if AuthEnty specifies a person. ISO 639-1 codes codes are strongly encouraged to be used.
Usage: If AuthEnty is a person, the organisational affiliation of that person

Usage: Freetext description on the metadata access conditions for the provided metadata for the study-related information only. Examples of such conditions are the copyright status, usage regulations based on legislation, a license, or other agreement concerning the metadata usage.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if '..stdyDscr/citation/prodStmt/copyright' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.

Usage: A name of the institution publishing the metadata, i.e. CESSDA Service Provider providing the metadata information or the name of the actual publisher of the metadata, who is not the SPs. Only on study level.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: The year or freetext date of when the study description was published. This element may be empty.
Required: Recommended if 'distDate' element is present

Usage: IDate (date-time combination (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS), date (YYYY-MM-DD), year-month (YYYY-MM), year (YYYY)) of publication (by publisher) of the study. Extract the year if only this is needed (e.g. citation). This element refers to the date (ISO 8601) when the data of the study was or will be made publicly available. If there is an embargo on the data in effect, use the date when the embargo period ends.
Usage: A title or name for the study group.
Required: Mandatory if '..serStmt/serName' element is present.
Usage: A value of a persistent identifier for the study group.
Required: Mandatory if ',,serInfo/ExtLink' element is present.
Usage: An URL or URN (a reference to a web resource that specifies its location) linking to the study group.
Required: Mandatory if ',,serInfo/ExtLink' element is present.
Usage: A required attribute containing the local user identification system. Always 'GroupID'.
Usage: A number of the version (free text) that the Service Provider uses to identify this version of the study.
Usage:A date of the version that the Service Provider uses to identify this version of the study.

Usage: Language of the study description page at the SP website (there can be multiple 'holding' elements for study description pages in different languages. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.
Usage: This is the document the metadata refers to, i.e. the URL of the study description page at the SP website.
EQB_UI_Label: Further information on study and data

Usage: Subject classifcation term for the study in the local language. Use descriptive terms from https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/vocabulary/TopicClassification if possible but other vocabularies are permitted.
Required: Mandatory if 'topcClas' element is present
Usage: Language of the subject classification term. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.
Usage: name of the vocabulary. If possible, use "CESSDA Topic Classification" (regardless of language) but other vocabularies are permitted.
Usage: The Canonical URL of the CV version that is being used e.g. https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/v2/vocabularies/TopicClassification/4.0?languageVersion=en-4.0
Usage: The abstract for the study
Usage: Language of the abstract. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.
Usage: This is the free text expression of the collection period. This element may be empty.
Required: Mandatory if parent is present
Usage: Either 'start', 'end' or 'single' to indicate the type of @date Attribute
Required: Recommended strongly if 'collDate' element is present.
Usage: Ideally YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ format, but can accept YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM or YYYY as date attribute. If there are multiple end dates, use the last.
Usage: Countries relevant to the study area
Required: Mandatory if 'nation' element is present
Usage: Language of the country label. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.
Usage: Use this attribute only if the country in the 'nation' element has an ISO 3166-1 2-letter code.
Usage: Contains the Time Method CV item in the local language
Required: Mandatory if 'timeMeth' element is present
Usage: Language of the Time Method CV item. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.

Usage: Time Method Controlled Vocabulary "Code value" that is the same across languages. e.g if the 'timeMeth' element is 'PitkittÃ¤isaineisto' for Finnish, the 'concept' element is 'Longitudinal'. See example at https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/urn/urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:TimeMethod
Usage: Use the string "DDI Time Method" regardless of language.
Usage: The Canonical URL of the CV version that is being used e.g. https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/v2/vocabularies/TimeMethod/1.2?languageVersion=en-1.2
Usage: Contains the Sampling Procedure CV item in the local language and/or a freetext description in the local language
Required: Mandatory if 'sampProc' element is present
Usage: Language of the Sampling Procedure CV item or freetext description. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.

Usage: Sampling Procedure Controlled Vocabulary "Code value" that is the same across languages. e.g if the 'sampProc' element is 'TodennÃ¤kÃ¶isyysotanta' for Finnish, the 'concept' element is 'Probability'. See example at https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/urn/urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:SamplingProcedure
Usage: Use the string "DDI Sampling Procedure" regardless of language.
Usage: The Canonical URL of the CV version that is being used e.g. https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/v2/vocabularies/SamplingProcedure/1.1?languageVersion=en-1.1
Usage: Contains the Mode of Collection CV item in the local language.
Required: Mandatory if 'collMode' element is present
Usage: Language of the Mode of Collection CV item. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used.

Usage: Mode of Collection Controlled Vocabulary "Code value" that is the same across languages. e.g if the 'collMode' element is 'Haastattelu' for Finnish, the 'concept' element is 'Interview'. See example at https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/urn/urn:ddi:int.ddi.cv:ModeOfCollection
Usage: Use the string "DDI Mode of Collection" regardless of language.
Usage: The Canonical URL of the CV version that is being used e.g. https://vocabularies.cessda.eu/v2/vocabularies/ModeOfCollection/3.0?languageVersion=en-3.0
Usage: The language of the instrument name that is being used in the study. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Usage: The language of the instrument name that is being used in the study. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used

Usage: Freetext description on the metadata access conditions for the provided metadata if there is one access condition for both study- and question-related metadata. Examples of such conditions are the copyright status, usage regulations based on legislation, a license, or other agreement concerning the metadata usage.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Required: Mandatory if '..stdyDscr/dataAccs/useStmt/specPerm/' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: Freetext description of possibilities to access data.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.

Usage: If the preserved content is subject to any access restrictions, those must be expressed in as much detail as possible in the information package in accordance with cataloguing rules and metadata formats used. Examples of such restrictions are the copyright status, usage restrictions based on legislation, a license, or other agreement concerning the content usage. Should the information package contain several digital objects with different restrictions, these restrictions should be attached correctly and individually to those objects that the restrictions concern.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if '..stdyDscr/dataAccs/useStmt/conditions/' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Required: Mandatory if '..codeBook/stdyDscr/othrStdyMat/relMat' element is present

Usage: Within the context of survey research, a showcard or showsheet is a visual aid used predominantly during in-person surveys. It is a card, a piece of paper, or an electronic screen containing answer categories to a question, from which the respondent chooses the answer to the survey question. showcardFileName is linked to the variable by using the /var/@name value for the relMat/@label value here
Required: Mandatory if '..codeBook/stdyDscr/othrStdyMat/relMat' element is present
Usage: Required to indicate that @label represents /var/@name value.
Usage: A file name of the showcard in the original language. Use 'parTitl' element if other languages are required.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Required: Mandatory if '..othrStdyMat/relMat/citation/titlStmt/titl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A file name of the showcard in anguages other than the original. Use 'titl' element for the original language.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Required: Mandatory if '..othrStdyMat/relMat/citation/titlStmt/parTitl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used

Usage: Freetext description on the metadata access conditions for the provided metadata for question-related information only. Examples of such conditions are the copyright status, usage regulations based on legislation, a license, or other agreement concerning the metadata usage.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if '..othrStdyMat/relMat/citation/prodStmt/copyright' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A link to the showcard
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Usage: A file name of the data set.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: An identifier that captures information on the type and value of a PID.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0
Required: Mandatory if '..fileDscr/fileTxt/fileCitation/titlStmt/IDNo' element is present.
Usage: The identification of the agency which assigns and manages the identifier, i.e., ISBN, ISSN, DOI, etc.
Usage: A name of a variable within a dataset.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A reference of a variable to a question e.g. 'QID1'
Usage: A variable can have different types according to the ways they can be studied, measured, and presented. E.g. 'Ordinal'
Usage: States the type of object being referenced e.g. 'code', 'mumeric' or 'text' for example.
Usage: Length of the text: Min length
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Usage: A label of a variable for display.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/labl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Required: Mandatory if '../dataDscr/var/qstn' element is present.
Required: Mandatory if '../dataDscr/var/qstn' element is present.
Usage: A version number of the question item.
Required: Mandatory if '../dataDscr/var/qstn' element is present.
Usage: ID of the question e.g. 'QID1'
Usage: An identifier provided by the user for the question.
Required: Mandatory if '..var/qstn/ExtLink' element is present.
Usage: Type of User ID for question. Always 'QuestionID'.
Usage: A label of a question item the metadata refers to for display.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/qstn/list/label' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A number of the question item the metadata refers to within the associated instrument.
Required: Mandatory if '..var/qstn/list/itm/' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A prequestion and/or postquestion and other statements as part of the question item text.
Required: Mandatory if '..var/qstn/preQTxt' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A literal question item text.
Required: Mandatory if '..var/qstn/qstnLit' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: An instruction for the interviewer.
Required: Mandatory if '..var/qstn/ivuInstr' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/valrng/range' element is present.
Usage: Structures a numeric range. Low value is designated
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/valrng/range' element is present.
Usage: Structures a numeric range. High value is designated
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgryGrp' element is present.
Usage: Category IDs in this Category group e.g. 'Ctgry1 Ctgry2'.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgryGrp' element is present.
Usage: An identifier of the codelist the metadata refers to.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgryGrp' element is present.
Usage: It indicates the minimum and the maximum number of possible answers within the codelist.
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if 'dataDscr/var/catgryGrp/labl' element is present.

Usage: @level attribute indicates whether the labl element is: (1) A name of the codelist (@level='name') OR (2) A label of the codelist (@level='label') OR (2) A description of the codelist (@level='description')
EQB_UI_Label: to be displayed in EQB v2.0.
Required: Mandatory if 'dataDscr/var/catgryGrp/labl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgry' element is present.
Usage: A value for missing data. If the category is describing a classification of "missing data" set the value of isMissing to "true".
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgry' element is present.
Usage: A structure that links a unique value of a code to a specified category.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgry' element is present.
Usage: A description of a particular category or response
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/catgry/labl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A name of the concept.
Required: Mandatory if '../dataDscr/var/concept' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A label of the concept.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/concept/list/itm/label' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A description of the concept.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/concept/list/itm/p' element is present
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: An additional description of the variable or the file content.
Required: Mandatory if '..dataDscr/var/notes' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Required: Mandatory if 'codeBook/otherMat' element is present.
Usage: A controlled vocabulary of the type of document that is provided.
Required: Mandatory if 'codeBook/otherMat' element is present.
Usage: Required for DDI schema. Object to which the document is related e.g. 'Study'.
Usage: A title for the document in the original language. Use the 'parTitl' element if Title is required for another language.
Required: Mandatory if '../otherMat/citation/titlStmt/titl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: A title for the document in a language other than the original.
Required: Mandatory if '../otherMat/citation/titlStmt/parTitl' element is present.
Usage: The language of the content of the element. ISO 639-1 codes are strongly encouraged to be used
Usage: An identifier for the document.
Required: Mandatory if '..otherMat/citation/titlStmt/IDNo' element is present.
Usage: Type of ID for the document ID. Always 'DocumentID'.
Usage: URL / Web address of the document the metadata refer to.
